studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Revised stable remission criteria to allow for a single excursion or missing assessment at specific weeks.
Removed the exclusion criterion for subjects missing MADRS assessments during the first 8 weeks of optimization.
Removed the option to stop the study for futility based on interim analysis results.
Modified antidepressant treatment requirements at study entry to improve recruitment.
Removed first-degree AV block as an exclusion criterion.

studyAmendmentReasons.reasonText: Enhance the number of clinically valid subjects proceeding to the Maintenance phase as stable remitters.
Potential outcome of placebo arm performing well may inform long-term use; therefore, study is not futile.
Based on feedback received from Investigators to improve recruitment.
Analyses of Phase 1 and 2 studies showed no impact of esketamine on PR interval.

studyChanges.beforeText: MADRS total score ≤12 for the last 4 weeks of the optimization phase
studyChanges.afterText: MADRS total score ≤12 for at least 3 of the last 4 weeks of the optimization phase, but one excursion of a MADRS total score >12 or one missing MADRS assessment is permitted at Optimization week 13 or 14 only. The MADRS total score at weeks 15 and 16 must be ≤12.
studyChanges.summary: Revised definition of stable remission to allow for one excursion or missing assessment.

studyChanges.beforeText: If ≥3 MADRS assessments are missed during the first 8 weeks of the optimization phase (Week 5 to Week 12), the subject can complete the optimization phase but is not eligible to participate in the maintenance phase.
studyChanges.summary: Removed eligibility restriction regarding missed MADRS assessments in early optimization.

studyChanges.beforeText: On Days 18, 22, and 25, the dose must remain stable (unchanged).
studyChanges.afterText: On Days 18, 22, and 25, a dose reduction from 84 mg to 56 mg is permitted if required for tolerability; no dose increase is permitted.
studyChanges.summary: Allowed dose reductions for tolerability on specific induction days previously requiring stable dosing.

studyChanges.beforeText: non-response (≤25% improvement) to ≥1 but ≤5 oral antidepressant treatments
studyChanges.afterText: non-response (≤25% improvement) to ≥2 but ≤5 (if current episode is > 2 years, upper limit is applicable to only the last 2 years) oral antidepressant treatments
studyChanges.summary: Increased minimum required antidepressant failures from 1 to 2 and clarified timeframe for long episodes.

studyChanges.beforeText: or 1st degree AV block with PR interval >200 msec
studyChanges.summary: Removed 1st degree AV block from ECG exclusion criteria.
